Explore remoteFront Desk Agentopportunities with flexible schedules and competitive salaries.View RemoteFront Desk AgentJobs →All Remote JobsEntry Level RemoteHigh-Paying RemoteJobs Requiring Similar SkillsIT ConsultantProblem SolvingCommunication$80,000 - $150,000Academic AdvisorProblem SolvingCommunication$40,000 - $65,000Customer Service RepresentativeCommunicationProblem Solving$30,000 - $50,000Client Services ManagerProblem SolvingCommunication$55,000 - $90,000Logistics CoordinatorCommunicationProblem Solving$40,000 - $60,000ConciergeCommunicationProblem Solving$30,000 - $50,000Explore by skill:Guest ServicesJobs →Reservation SystemsJobs →CommunicationJobs →Problem SolvingJobs →Front Desk AgentJob Market inQuebec CityQuebec City offers a growing job market for Front Desk Agent professionals. While Government leads the local economy, there's steady demand for Front Desk Agent roles across various sectors. The market for Front Desk Agent positions remains stable, with opportunities in both established companies and emerging businesses. Quebec City's growing economy and quality of life attract both local talent and professionals relocating from larger cities.Top Companies HiringFront Desk Agents inQuebec CityGovernment officesLocal businessesRegional employersMajor employers hiring Front Desk Agents in Quebec City include Government offices, Local businesses, Regional employers. These organizations offer competitive compensation packages and career growth opportunities for qualified Front Desk Agents.Front Desk AgentSalary inQuebec Cityvs Other CitiesFront Desk Agent salaries in Quebec City typically range from $26,600 to $38,000 annually. This is approximately 24% lower than Toronto, but the lower cost of living often results in similar take-home purchasing power.Cost of Living forFront Desk Agents inQuebec CityLiving in Quebec City as a Front Desk Agent means navigating a cost of living that's close to the national average. Average rent for a 1-bedroom apartment is approximately $1,500/month (12% below national average). With Front Desk Agent salaries starting around $28,000, Quebec City offers good value for Front Desk Agent professionals.95Cost Index (100 = avg)549KPopulationGrowingTech Hub4+Major IndustriesCommuting as aFront Desk AgentinQuebec CityQuebec City mix of public transit and car commuting. Key transit tips: Check transit routes to your potential workplace. Consider commute time when choosing where to live.Quebec City offers various neighborhoods suitable for Front Desk Agent professionals, with options ranging from urban cores to suburban areas with good transit access.Frequently Asked Questions AboutFront Desk AgentJobs inQuebec CityWhat is the average Front Desk Agent salary in Quebec City?Front Desk Agent salaries in Quebec City typically range from $26,600 to $38,000 annually, depending on experience and company size. Quebec City's moderate cost of living means these salaries offer good purchasing power.Is Quebec City a good city for Front Desk Agents?Quebec City offers growing opportunities for Front Desk Agent professionals. Government and Technology are the dominant industries, creating consistent demand. The city's population of 549K supports a diverse job market with both established companies and emerging businesses.What's the cost of living like for Front Desk Agents in Quebec City?Quebec City's cost of living index is 95 (national average = 100). The lower cost of living means your salary goes further compared to cities like Toronto or Vancouver.What skills are essential for Front Desk Agent roles?Key skills for Front Desk Agent positions include Guest Services, Reservation Systems, Communication, as well as Problem Solving and Multitasking. Employers particularly value candidates who can demonstrate practical experience with these competencies through projects, certifications, or previous work experience.What are the most in-demand jobs in Canada right now?Healthcare workers (nurses, PSWs), tech professionals (developers, data scientists), skilled trades, and finance professionals are consistently in high demand. The specific roles vary by province—tech dominates in major cities while skilled trades are sought across the country. Immigration programs prioritize many of these occupations.How do I find jobs in Canada as a newcomer?Start with major job boards (Indeed, LinkedIn, Workopolis) and company career pages. Networking is crucial—attend industry events and join professional associations. Consider settlement agencies that offer employment services. Some industries value Canadian experience, so entry-level positions or internships may be initial stepping stones.What benefits do Canadian employers typically offer?Beyond salary, Canadian employers often provide health and dental insurance, retirement savings matching (RRSP), paid vacation (minimum 2-3 weeks), parental leave top-ups, professional development budgets, and increasingly, flexible work arrangements. Benefits packages vary significantly between companies and industries.Is work-life balance really better in Canada?Compared to the US, Canada generally offers better work-life balance with more vacation time, parental leave, and cultural expectations around reasonable hours. However, this varies by industry and company. Startups and certain finance roles may demand more hours. Most provinces mandate minimum vacation time and overtime rules.All Hospitality & Tourism Jobs in Quebec CityHotel ManagerRestaurant ManagerEvent CoordinatorConciergeBanquet ManagerFood and Beverage ManagerChefSous ChefBartenderCatering ManagerHousekeeping ManagerExplore11morehospitality & tourismresources.Career ResourcesFront Desk AgentSalary GuideInterview QuestionsResume ExamplesCover Letter ExamplesJob DescriptionRelated Jobs inQuebec CityHotel ManagerRestaurant ManagerEvent CoordinatorConciergeBanquet ManagerFood and Beverage ManagerPopular Jobs inQuebec CitySoftware EngineerData ScientistProduct ManagerWeb DeveloperFront Desk Agentin Other CitiesTorontoONMontrealQCCalgaryABOttawaONEdmontonABVancouverBCMississaugaONBramptonONExplore More OpportunitiesBy Experience LevelEntry LevelJuniorMid-LevelSeniorExecutiveBy Salary RangeHigh Paying$100k+$150k+Related FieldsCustomer ServiceRetailfood-serviceAll Remote Jobs•Interview Prep•Resume Examples•Salary GuidesGet Hired FasterCreate an AI-optimized resume tailored forFront Desk Agentjobs inQuebec City.Get Started Free

matched_jobs.title: Billposter, General Labourer, Astral Media
matched_jobs.description: Skip to main contentCareers HomeSearch jobs by keywordSearch jobs by locationCareers HomeLanguageEnglishFrançaisView my profileEmployee LoginSearch jobs by keywordSearch jobs by locationSelect how often to receive alerts (in days):Create alert×Select how often to receive alerts (in days):Apply now »Media Technical OperationsFeb 17, 2026Billposter, General Labourer, Astral MediaReq Id:428203Connection is everything. It drives us to innovate, explore, and stay close to what matters to us most. At Bell, we’re building a more connected future through world-class networks, AI-powered solutions, and digital experiences that elevate how people live, work, and play every day.We believe in empowering people. That’s why we equip our teams with cutting-edge technology, AI tools, and a collaborative environment that supports creativity and growth. Want to be part of a diverse team where your work makes a real impact? If you’re inspired by innovation that advances how people connect and transforms what’s possible, you belong on #TeamBell.Be at the forefront of one of the most exciting and ever-changing industries. On the Bell Media team you will be a part of creating and delivering the best Canadian and international content across digital media, television, radio and out-of-home advertising platforms. You’ll join a team of passionate and driven innovators, who are breaking barriers and expanding the reach of Canada’s most-loved entertainment.At Bell Media, you’ll redefine digital connections and pioneer next-generation services, propelling us to reach new heights, unlock untapped potential and expand horizons for our customers.Key ResponsibilitiesPosting outdoor advertising copy as scheduled, climbing up to heights of 50’ to 70’Providing operational support as directedPrepping poster/vinyl signsPrepping cut-outs or building 4’ X 10’ wooden sectionsWorking outdoors in inclement weatherOperating a lawn mower; carrying a ladder at waist level, shoveling snowInstallation and Maintenance of Sign structuresInstallation and Maintenance of Transit sheltersEnsuring all health and safety policies and procedures are followedOther duties as requiredCritical QualificationsHighschool DiplomaA proactive self-starter with a team attitude and a willingness to learnAbility to work at heightsModerate to heavy lifting up to 75 lbsOrganized and dependable individual who can work with minimal supervisionMust have a good attendance recordMust have (green patch) safety bootsValid driver’s licenseWorking ConditionsSchedule, Monday to Friday 7 AM to 3.30 PMSuccessful candidates will be required to complete pre-employment testing confirming their ability to perform the essential duties of the position. Satisfactory completion of this test is a mandatory pre-condition to employment in this roleAdequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.Additional Information:Position Type:UnionJob Status:Regular - Full TimeJob Location:Canada : Quebec : Quebec CityWork Arrangement:Full-time in office (meaning that you will be required to perform your work on-site)Application Deadline:03/03/2026Total earning range:$24.00 - $29.71. The advertised salary range is based on the wage scales and classifications outlined in the applicable collective bargaining agreement. The specific hourly rate within the negotiated range will be determined based on factors such as the candidate’s qualifications and experience.For work arrangements that are ‘Hybrid’, successful candidates must be based in Canada and report to a set Bell office for a minimum of 3 days a week.  Recognizing the importance of work-life balance, Bell offers flexibility in work hours based on the business needs.Please apply directly online to be considered for this role.  Applications through email will not be accepted.We know that caring for our team members is at the heart of a healthy, positive and thriving workplace. As part of our team, you’ll enjoy a comprehensive compensation package that includes a competitive salary and a wide range of benefits to support the well-being of you and your family. As soon as you join us, you'll be eligible for medical, dental, vision and mental health benefits that you can tailor to your specific needs. Plus, as a Bell team member, you'll enjoy a 35% discount on our services and access exclusive offers from our partners.At Bell, we are proud of our focus on fostering an inclusive and accessible workplace where all team members feel valued, respected, supported, and that they belong.Bell is committed to clarity in our hiring process. All roles posted are opportunities we’re actively recruiting for, unless stated otherwise. We also want to make sure that everyone has an equal opportunity to join our team. We encourage individuals who may require accommodations during the hiring process to let us know. For a confidential inquiry, email your recruiter orrecruitment@bell.cato make arrangements.If you have questions or feedback regarding accessibility at Bell, we invite you to complete theAccessibility feedback formor visit ourAccessibility pagefor other ways to contact us.Artificial intelligence may be used to assess parts of your application. Please review our privacy policy (see Phenom for details) to learn more about how we collect, use, and disclose your personal information.Created:Canada,QC,Quebec CityBell, one ofCanada's Top 100 Employers.Apply now »Find similar jobs:Media - Internal,Media,Internal Jobs,Customer Experience - Internalbell.caBell BlogPrivacy© Bell Canada, 2025.
